revised_title: Temperature and Salinity Effects on the Velocity of Explosion Waves in Sea Water
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the velocity of explosion waves in sea water and found that the velocity is affected by temperature and salinity. An increase of 1°C in temperature results in an increase of about 11 ft/sec in the velocity, while an increase of 1 part per 1000 in salinity results in a corresponding increase of 3-4 ft/sec in the velocity.
